agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides transportation to medical appointments for area veterans to the veterans' hospital or clinic in Indianapolis or Terre Haute, Indiana. Vehicle is not wheelchair accessible.
site_details: Call at least 7 days in advance.
site_eligibility: Veterans living in Clay County -- With an appointment at the veterans' hospital or clinic in Indianapolis or Terre Haute, Indiana

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call or email for information.
site_eligibility: Veteran -- surviving spouses -- children of a veteran

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_name: FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES OF WEST CENTRAL INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides education, intervention, and supportive services, including domestic violence and sexual assault victim advocacy, healthy families, and the Putnam County Recovery Coalition.
site_name: FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES OF WEST CENTRAL INDIANA - CLAY COUNTY
service_name: DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT PROGRAM - CLAY COUNTY
service_description: Provides support, education, and advocacy to men and women who have been victims of violence. Services include court advocacy, protective orders, safe shelter, domestic violence education, safety plans, referrals, support groups, on-going support, educational groups, and awareness programming.
site_details: Call and ask for advocate. -- For after hours emergencies, call 9-1-1, 765-655-1295, or county dispatch.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Female, male, or transgender -- Direct and indirect victims of domestic violence

service_description: Provides free weatherization for moderate- to low-income homeowners and renters. Services may include attic insulation, weather-stripping, and foundation, heat duct, and water pipe insulation. Furnace repair or replacement may be provided in some cases.
site_details: Call for initial phone assessment.
site_eligibility:
Living in Clay, Putnam, or Vigo County
Household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Guidelines

service_description: Provides comprehensive family medicine services including family planning, physicals (work, school, and sport), vision care, and laboratory services. Sliding-scale fees are available for income-eligible clients.

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A 24-hour crisis intervention agency that provides inpatient and outpatient behavioral health care; mental health and addictions treatment for all ages.
service_name: OUTPATIENT MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES - CLAY COUNTY
service_description: Provides individual, group, couple, and family counseling for adults, adolescents, and children on a walk-in basis. Also offers psychiatric and psychological assessment, consultation, and treatment services. A 24-hour crisis line is available, with referrals to locations in Clay, Greene, Parke, Putnam, Sullivan, Vermillion, and Vigo County.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call the office for information or to a schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open (minimum age served determined by individual assessment) -- Living in Clay, Owen, Parke, Putnam, Sullivan, or Vigo county

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

site_name: DICK JOHNSON TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - CLAY COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. site_name: VAN BUREN TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - CLAY COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Clay County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides information on head lice treatment, referrals to low-cost treatment products, and can perform a head check upon request.
site_details: Call to see if nurse is available.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the county

agency_desc: A government agency that provides health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Conducts local health fairs, provides health education services to the public, and maintains the lending library and other information resources for the County.
site_details: Call for information about arranging a group presentation.
site_eligibility: Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect health and safety of Clay County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air and water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Accepts mosquito complaints and provides information about air, water, and soil quality, including where to obtain testing.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Clay County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Clay County.

site_eligibility: Open; serves Clay County

- To and from Terre Haute: Fri 8am-3pm

site_eligibility: Have lived in Indiana for at least 30 days -- Age 18 or older (recommended); ages 16-17 may be eligible to take the test  with a letter of recommendation signed by a superintendent of an Indiana public  school system -- Not enrolled in high school

site_eligibility: Meet low-income guidelines from eligible income sources such as employment, pension, Social Security, SSI, SSDI -- No rent or judgments owed to any Public Housing Authority -- Satisfactory criminal history; ask for details

site_eligibility: Household income below set limits -- Preference given to families with children, seniors, and people with disabilities

service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee.
